definition: fault/mistake/to miss (a chance)
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo
to lose/to miss/to fail

sentences.english: Mark Viduka's missed header in the first half.
sentences.chinese: 維杜卡上半場錯失的那個頭球。

sentences.english: If you stick to Google, you'll also miss out on social searching.
sentences.chinese: 假如你死盯Google，你將錯失社會化搜索。

sentences.english: Take it easy, but take it.
sentences.chinese: 放輕鬆，但是不要錯失良機。

sentences.english: How do you find a thing you have mislaid or forgotten?
sentences.chinese: 你如何找回你已經錯失或遺忘的東西哩？

sentences.english: Barak says this is an opportunity not to be missed.
sentences.chinese: 巴拉克說，這是一個不能錯失的機會。

sentences.english: To sentiment reason which late comes, treasures well, no longer error predestined match.
sentences.chinese: 對遲來的情緣，好好珍惜，不再錯失良緣。

sentences.english: And, along the way, we’re sabotaging our chances.
sentences.chinese: 順着這條路，我們正錯失機會。

sentences.english: If you've missed the falling dollar rally to date, don't do anything stupid.
sentences.chinese: 如果你錯失了迄今爲止的美元下跌的反彈，別做傻事。

sentences.english: The widespread concern is that a home-educated child misses out on"socialisation".
sentences.chinese: 人們普遍認爲在家教育孩子會錯失孩子的社會意識。

sentences.english: 'They cannot afford not to participate, ' Mr. Gheit said.
sentences.chinese: 他說，這些公司無法承受錯失機會的後果。

sentences.english: It was a missed opportunity as well.
sentences.chinese: 它還是一個錯失的良機。

sentences.english: Sinclair also just missed the target when one on one with the goalkeeper.
sentences.chinese: 辛克萊爾同樣在禁區裏1對1時錯失良機。

sentences.english: Too often we miss beautiful sources of inspiration, because we’re too busy thinking about other things.
sentences.chinese: 由於忙於思考或其他瑣事，我們經常錯失靈感的泉源。

sentences.english: Yao layup. Mike James missed free throw.
sentences.chinese: 姚明上籃，詹姆斯錯失罰球。

sentences.english: Usually we don't miss free-throws like that.
sentences.chinese: 通常我們不會像今天一樣錯失罰球。

sentences.english: I lost the two finals and also missed that black which has since given me a few sleepless nights.
sentences.chinese: 我輸掉了兩場決賽，同時也因睡眠不足而錯失了黑球。

definition: a good chance/a golden opportunity
to renounce/to abandon/to give up
to have no opportunity/no way (of doing sth)/no chance/no connection/not placed (in a competition)/(in pop lyrics) no chance of love, no place to be together etc
lapse/mistake/to make a mistake/fault/service fault (in volleyball, tennis etc)
to confront/to face
valuable/precious/to value/to treasure/to set store by
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
to delay/to hold up/to waste time/to interfere with
fortunate timing/occasion/opportunity
the end/an ending/to wind down/to conclude
of short duration/brief/momentary
to show initiative/to be a go-getter/to push forward with one's agenda
to cut short/to break off/to discontinue/to interrupt
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to come and go/to have friendly relations with/in the past/previous
